column11: Review Text

Kandy is well worth setting aside a day to explore.  Apart from the Temple of the Tooth and Kandy Lake, there's lot to explore in the city.  And the best way to explore Kandy is definitely by Tuk Tuk. You not only avoid the traffic jams, but also receive the best local knowledge at a fraction of the cost of organised tours. Our Tuk Tuk driver Saman was brilliant - warm, friendly and very knowledgeable - one the best in Sri Lanka (Whats App +94 72 290 9182).  Saman took us to through the amazing meat, fish and vegetable markets in central Kandy (I think they're the best in Sri Lanka). We also explored the local shopping area, colonial buildings and stunning lookouts of Kandy city.  But the best was yet to come, Saman took us to a local restaurant where we had our best Sri Lankan meal of the trip. The black curry ckicken was amazing.  And to top it off, Saman dropped us off at Kandy station the next day and waited until we boarded, to make sure we on board and no one took our seats !  A truly memorable experience which deserves 6 stars, not 5 !

Visited the food court on the forth floor. The variety of food was excellent and I'm sure there is something for everyone. The premises are spotless and the staff keen and helpful. The food was exceptionally nice especially the stir fried beef dish from the Chinese section

It's nice to have a wander around, it's cooler than outside so also provides some respite in that regard Standard fare of mall shops with a few pop up stalls Nice to have a look around but if you don't get time you won't have missed anything

We had diner in the restaurant at the top floor of the Kandy city center. When you enter you get a card to use with your order. The atmosphere was a little boring, but the food was good! You can choose from different meals and drinks, and the system with the tickets works well. You can go here to find a taste for everyone at your party!
Nice mall. Have to pay rs 30 to use washroom, but the wash rooms were muddy and wet and without soap
For us Europeans who are used to very high standards, it is difficult to find this shopping center in the heart of Kandy interesting.
Good place to spend some time. Classy shops and ambiance. Live music at the lobby if your lucky. Things are a bit pricy, but quality is high. Bank stalls available
It cover most of your shopping needs with vast variety of stalls. There is a decent indoor play area for kids at reasonable prices and well trained staff. Play zones issue tickets valid for 30 mins.

Very nice place, compared to the city being simple this a very advanced place. Clean, has few shops and the cloth price is relatively good. The food court is the highlight of the place, nice food and good variety with a good seating partially overseeing Kandy lake
Got the chance to visit the cinema for a special screening. It was a good experience. Clean and comfortable. Good sound system too.

If you want to have full experience in Kandy you should hire him. He showed us so many beautiful places in just one day. He has a big comfortable van for a group and a Tuk tuk for two Namal  +94 77 661 8292 WhatsApp

A lot of various shops having  Sri Lankan and famous international brands. Even the food court has many varieties. It is located at heart of the city and convenient to all. Finding the parking at the car park is bit tiring.

This a shopping mall located in the city centre of Kandy. There is a foodcourt concept eatery place with variety of international cuisine, but we didn’t try the food there because it is rather pricey and we wanted to have local Sri Lankan food. There is a supermarket convenient for us since we are staying nearby. Nothing much for us since we are not the shopping type of tourists.
They have a play area and a food court right on top, and have a few Shoping attractions at the next few floors.

Kandy doesn’t really have much to offer.  A very congested city center with lots of cars, buses, and tuk tuks vying for the same small road. This shopping mall is par for that course.  Not much on offer.  Some clothes and electronics shops. A few shops selling fragrances.  A floor with a bunch of banks.  A small supermarket in the basement.  And food on the top floor. Not an impressive mall.

Word spice is a great restaurant it's a spacious area and there's tons of options you can choose from. I had a lovely grilled chicken burger which was delicious. The only complaint I have is that the patty was bit under grilled but it was still very good.

We had dinner at the World Spice food court here on our first night in Kandy. There are 5-6 different cuisines to choose from. We had a Chicken Thai fried rice, fried cuttle fish & chicken fried rice and Carbonara Chicken & Pork spaghetti from Thai, Chinese and Italian counters respectively. Everything was delicious but we found the cuttle fish to be quite chewy. For desserts we had hazelnut mousse and blueberry cheese cake from the Mexican counter which again was quite good. Other available cuisines were Indian, Sri Lankan and there was also a counter serving all kinds of beverages. Seating and ambience is also quite nice. Overall a good experience.

My husband and I visited the food court twice during our stay in Kandy. You get a choice of Chinese,  Indian,  Thai, Sri Lankan and Italian food. The food is freshly made infront of you. We had spring rolls, chicken in honey glace  with rice and tandoori  paneer with naan . We also tried the butter chicken combo meal. All the food we had was delicious and the staff was throughout friendly and helpful We can highly recommend to visit the KCC food court, you also get free wifi  if you need a break and the seats are comfy to chill in with a view over the lake .
Hi, Its the real shopping complex included all thing and very close to the main temple . Also relaxing time spending walk can there.
Nice place to visit. The modern food court is out of this world. We had Italian, Thai and Sri lankan food. Cooked in an open kitchen. Food wast tasty and well presented.
Had lunch with my family. Lots of choices and the food tasted very good. The place was very clean and well maintained. The cutlery was also very clean and overall service is efficient.

We got nice and good hospitality service from the 4th floor restaurant @KCC, specially Mr.Lanthra (Restaurant F&B Manager) and the food was delicious - keep up the good work, Thank you very much to make our lunch time happy on 16/08/2019
It is a nice shopping mall in Kandy. You get brand shops and food court. Air conditioned and clean. We enjoyed roaming around for some time there.

KCC is a amazing place for shopping and for dining with different varieties of food.we were guided by Mr.Lantra who was there and he was explaining everything about food and restaurants at KCC. I would highly recommend this place , superb service and excellent experience

I had read many reviews explaining what a great city Kandy was, and how beautiful it was there - I don’t know what you were talking about. I’ve been to many Asian cities, and Kandy was by far the ugliest city. First it is a quite big, busy and noicy city. We got here by the train from Ella, and our hotel was in walking distance from the train station. The streets had garbage all over, and the city smelled bad. Also there was only bad quality shops there. No unique market items - just the same old elephant baggy trousers in every shop. So not much shopping here. Both Ella and Arugam Bay had much better shopping alternatives. We actually even got scammed by a person we Met in the street. He came over very enthusiastic saying Hello, and asking if we recognized him. He worked at our hotel but of course we didn’t recognize him without his uniform. Every other city in sri Lanka the people has been so friendly, that we didn’t think much about it. He asked if we wanted him to show us around, and we said sure. Suddenly we were in the market shop of his brother asking us to buy some Things to help his brothers shop going around. Felt obligated to buy an overpriced scarf. We also walked to the lake. To be honest it wasn’t that special - just an ordinary lake. Quite filthy and the rails were covered in plastic full of bird poop. Actually I would just recommend you to skip Kandy! There are so many beautiful cities in Sri Lanka that are better to see.
Whenever we visit Kandy, we always like to visit KCC for shopping. It has everything form clothes, food to banks.
Shopping complex was amazing, modern design and cleanliness was excellent. They are maintaining the property well. Security system was helpful for all customers.thank you for your great hospitality

Categorize people by their wardrobes and poor customer service. Workers don’t bother for anything other than scanning you top to bottom. Food court is a utter mess. Never seen such an complicated food court anywhere in the world. WORST PLACE EVER
wish there were coffee shops ... I hope there will be in the future. I enjoyed the cultural interior designs and the people were friendly too.

This is in the hear of kandy city. Just walking distance from temple of tooth. There are many shops is 5 foors. Down foor is a bank street, you can find branches of every bank in sri lanka. All the major brands shops aee in other 3 floors. Top foor is food stalls and small  rollercoster. 4th foor good for children as it has many games to enjoy.
Great food and a great choice. Kandy's only shopping mall with many choices to select from. Enjoyed spending time there.
It’s a quit good Centre. But I was wishing it’s bigger. They have plenty of shops. Very good variety food court. But there’s no coffee shops.

one of the best shopping experience you could ever get at kandian kingdon of srilanka there are numerious shops ranging from clothing accessories,electric items , supermarkets book shops and many more. large parking area is also available a play area for kids with multiple gaming options . and finally the food court,,,its huge and you can find italian ,indian chinese thai and srilanka foods there and many more all together a good experience if you happen to visit kandy srilanka
A nice shopping place. You can go here if you are a Baskin Robins icecream fan. Oh well I am! There is one supermarket too. Some clothes stores with Sri Lankan specific clothes can be found too.
Good and nice place for shopping.  Located near Kandy lake it has big showrooms. Food Court on top floor is good having tasty cuisine from 5 regions.

It was one of the best hangout places Ive been to.There were various choices of food and spices and it was very impressive..The day we visited was a bit crowded thou.overall it was a good recommendation to shop.

Well maintained handy shopping mall located in the heart of the city centre.  Location has a reasonable collection of local/ global fashion brands, cosmetics, snacks, coffee shops, banks and ATMs . Ground floor has a supermarket with groceries needed for daily use. Upper floor food court "Worldspice" is a different experience fills the taste buds. A cozy attraction for all travelers.

A rarity in this part of the world - an indoor  air - conditioned  shopping centre. With plenty of international  standard shops to look at with good prices. Plus a proper food court with something for all tastes. Plenty of car parking next door. Well worth a visit

This review is for the food court located on the top floor of the mall. Best food we enjoyed in entire sri lanka trip . They had specialized chefs  for all the outlets. Chinese, Thai, indian etc. We tried the Chinese and Thai food which was outstanding. Authentic flavours and good taste. Even the drinks offered were well prepared. NOT at all expensive. Overall a worth visit.
We had dinner at KCC twice. Plenty of food choice, good prices and lovely views. The only downside is that it closes early (10pm). Try the desserts also, they are lovely!

I've been in Kandy for a few days now, and have really enjoyed the food at a number of different downtown restaurants. A friend recommended the food court on the 4th floor of the City Center building, so I went there and tried the Indian. First off the place has NO ambiance, it is literally a food court with no wait staff, etc. The problem was that I ordered mutton biryani (sp?) which was so fatty and tough the meat was inedible. An extremely small portion of salad was served on the side of the plate. This for the high price of 900 rupees. But the real kicker came when I paid the bill only to discover that my 2 small cans of coke also cost 900 rupees. When it was all over, my bill for a crappy dinner was 2211 rupees, and you can get much much better almost anywhere for a quarter of the price. This place is a little tricky, too, since the coke "station" just rang up my purchase on a card without telling me the price. Only when I went to leave was the card scanned into the cash register and the total ripp-off was revealed to me.  There are so many good places to eat in Kandy, I beg you to stay away from this awful food court. The mall in the building is nice, though, and worth a visit.

We visited KCC with 2 kids. Did some groceries shopping and had lunch at the food court which was really good. The World Play on the other hand is a terrible tourist trap! They charge to much for every small attraction. Kids can only play by themselves because parents have to stay behind the fences... They strictly keep the time (max. 20min) and make sure you have a coin or ticket before you enter. Our kids enjoyed themselves but we would never go here again!

Kandy City Centre is fully fledged shopping mall in Kandy, Sri Lanka. Everything including shopping, dinning, entertainment also available. Food Court, Grocery shopping, garments, electrical items, all the banks, accessories, perfumes also available for shopping. They have Kids Play Area and need to pay for entry and games. There is a proper washroom area. You can use for very reasonable price cheaper than dirty Kandy city other washrooms. And much cleaner. Unfortunately, they don't have good car porch which is essential to shopping mall. And you have to get wet if it is raining. And There is a Major issue of this shopping mall. They don't have any single seating facility to occupy one person inside the mall. Only small area of steps available near keells at ground floor. And always KCC security officers are yelling at people if they try to sit. But, busy time, people have to seat that poor seating facility. So, I think, they have to improve seating facilities to ensure the usage of their shopping mall. I am a regular customer of their mall and I visit daily for my consumer needs. So, I really unpleasant about their poor seating facilities. My most of needs fulfill by this mall shops and I think this feature must be improved. Anyhow, very good facility to Kandy.

Being in a very close proximity to the Dalada Maaligawa, the temple of Buddha's tooth relic, the KCC is a very busy place for shoppers and tourists. It is the hotspot in heart of the Kandy. All kinds of showrooms are there including the famous brands. Armoured with all latest high tech comfortabilities this place provides an opportunity for relaxed shopping and even you can rest a while if you are tired walking along the streets. No entrance fee charged. Most of the banks, ATMs, Mobile network supplies are available. Food court and Roots juice bar are also available. Paid, clean toilets available on the ground floor. Only issue recently we met is the problem with parking. Previously there was an ample space for free parking. Now it has been reduced due to some ongoing construction. But, still you can park at the Cargill's food city park or at the urban council park (both paid) nearby.

We found the Kandy City Center to be better than any of the three shopping malls we visited in Colombo. For example, we found their "Cotton Collection" store to be much better supplied, with better quality merchandise that was better displayed than their store we visited in the capital. The entire center was very clean, looked modern and new, had a large variety of clean and modern stores, with well-displayed widows  plus a wonderful Gelateria on the top floor. Very much worth a try...
You can find anything under the one roof. Nice food coats , quality fashanable clothes places and house holding items are available

During a visit to the City of Kandy, my family visited the Kandy City Centre (KCC) for some shopping therapy and quick lunch during September and was quite happy with our experience. The arcade had plenty of shopping options ( clothing , shoes and bags, gold, electronics ,household items etc,)and  had many banks located centrally supporting any needs for financial requirements such as currency and atC exchange. We were most surprised and happy with their food court, which was in par with any high-end food court in Malaysia or Singapore with international food cuisines available. The prices too were very competitive and portion sizes quite large, pricing value for money. It was indeed a very pleasant afternoon spent shopping and enjoying tasty quality food in an lovely environment !

Guys, this place called Kandy has nothing for tourists and you will only be struggling in this below average town. The whole city centre is a downmarket place with local made stuff that includes slippers, bags, multi colored shorts and puffed rice. Please do not waste time and money behind the lovely name ‘Kandy’. There is a lake, yes, so? Nothing great about it. Food: below average eateries. Thankfully there is a funny empty mall with a food court and could something to eat there. What to buy: absolutely nothing at all. What to see: lake What to do: sleep by 7PM as the streets go empty by this time. Overall: a big NO Unless there is a religious attachment of buddhism. In that case, there is Buddha teeth relic to see for an extrance fee. Caution: do not go behind the typical google items like ‘top 10 things to do in Kandy’. Trust me there are no such things. FYI Typing this review watching TV in kandy hotel. Can imagine what sort of tourist place this is. Rest is all upto ones personal choices. Pictures attached of lake and street at 7:13PM. Gn

Situated in the heart of the town. A leading shopping complex in the country. Variety of shops including clothing, foods, electronic items, mobile phones, food stalls, leading banks etc. Fourth floor has the world spice food stalls and playing area.

Yes its really enjoyable dinning with my family . we were there around 2 hours to shopping purpose and finally deiced to take lunch from KCC food court , Its a clean and nice place to have the dine . Tasty Indian food is there and larger are to select the food with several types several taste. Also good in beverage by tasty smoothies. hope to be there next time when i'm travelling to Kandy.

Enjoying places for shopping and dining’ since you opened I have been using kcc for my everything  at under one roof billing banking free WiFi specially best kids play area my kids love it we go Twice a week  !!! Chami
Eating at a mall / food court, I should have known better. The place is clean but lacks atmosphere and is overpriced. So much better food and choices throughout SL.
Bad food...prices are too steep... unhygienic...not worth the money..naan was dry and thick...Indians won't enjoy the food

You will find it same as any other mall in a city. You get shops of all kinds from Banks to clothes. Food court has good options for all cuisines.  Branded shopping can be done here if needed. How ever I don't recommend to go here for tourism.There are my good places to spend quality time in this city.  I wish I could have avoided this place and spent more time at downtown.

Kandy is a great city. Lots to do here - Buddhist sacred temple, botanical garden and the city is also great for shopping. Food eating options are plenty - our favourite was the food court at the mall.

KCC shopping mall and food court add value to Kandy city.Branded shops ,Banks,super market ,Childrens play area and the food court, Srilanka,India, Chinese Thai you name they have with lots of choice of beverages.
the best food court you can see, the food very clean, you can find Indian, Thai, Italian and Chinese corners , the food itself is very delicious, but it is very expensive .

It offers more than outside and is at least clean, until you use the toilet! In which they should have paid me to use, not the other way round! But don’t get your hopes up. There isn’t anything special in there apart from a decent Thomas Cook currency exchange. We just spent 90mins walking around to break up some of our time in Kandy which was far too long (5 nights). We don’t recommend staying anywhere in Sri Lanka for more than 2 nights, 3 at the very maximum. We felt it’s extremely over rated compared to other places in Asia like Borneo and Indonesia...I cannot say is rush back.
One best heritage shopping mall in sri Lanka.located in central of kandy. reasonable price and very clean mall.
Found all the banks and leading companies in one place. Good place to do all the day to day work in same building. Play area for kids is gift since we do not have any in Kandy.

What kandy has been wanting for a long time . I was surprised to see the food variation . Very well organized  . Tasty food and beverages . Play area for kids. Very clean. Had most of our meals here . Keep the great work going

Whether you want to go shopping, are in dire need of some cooling air-condition, want to fill your stomach with international food in the World Spice Food Court or need to use a comparatively clean toilet, this is the place to go. Conveniently also offering parking, a supermarket, several banks and fashion stores, the KCC is modern and a nice change from everything else. Beware though, everything seems to cost twice as much in there, whether it's phones or clothes.

Kandy city center is a shopping mall with lots of shops. Well maintained and clean. It has a supermarket and some deli shops. As well as lots of shopping slots. Food court is amazing and offer chinee Indian etc food. It has a nice view also. Kidds play area is attractive.
They have Open Kitchen and array of food, be it Indian, Italian, Thai or Chineese with a juice and dessert corners.
Realy worthwhile trying this foodcourt. Esspecially with young children who want something else then local food. Good value for your money

I highly recommend as the food prepared here on open kitchen concept and the guest get to see there meals being prepared. The Chefs hear are amazingly friendly and helpful. Quantity of the serving was very good and the quality along with the food served time. Ideally great for families with children too as the play area is the same vicinity. Please keep making those yummy food and beverages.

Absolute best selection available in Kandy. Three main menus' as Thai, Italian and Chinese were available. Nice view overlooking the lake. Makes the feel for a luxurious dining experience. I felt like I was dining at a metro, with the electronic turnstill systems they had. The interior design they have used is amazing. Good Luck KCC Dining Loft and Thank You, for the amazing hospitality.

While adults enjoy the scenic views of Kandy city and suburb, kids tend to get restless and wants to have something of their type. An entertainment area in Kandy City Center is an ideal place for your young ones to enjoy, play games while you shop around. A must go place.

Manage constructing it in the middle of kandy .It links together the necessities of people ,but need some improvements as well.some shops were still close and out of business .Close to Temple of tooth and Kandy lake.Nice place with AC
A place where things you need in daily life are all there. Can't complain much regarding the price. It is one of the nice shopping center other than the capital itself.

We expected a western mall (like those in south east Asia or Delhi); this isn’t it.  Food court is very limited - three restaurants.   Not many western brands (which isn’t a bad thing) and a focus on services (banks, mobile phone recharge and supermarket).  We didn’t want to hang out there - we were quickly in and out.
All banks and all show rooms of leading companies are there. Fully air conditioned. Rooftop you can find good restaurants.
Quality mall with many good shops. Price tags are bit high end but you can find branded stuffs and very conveniently located at the city center as it’s name.

If you dont like the a very crowded smoggy city dont go to the city center to much. It takes alot of time to travel with any public transportation and walking isnt that comfortable. Tip!: stay at feel home hotel! Outside if the city center and a host who helps you with everything and even gives you rides to the city. Also fantastic view from the rooms.

One of the best shopping center heart of the kandy. i would say much better that Colombo shopping centers coz will be able to purchase anything that you want in one roof. i  loved "Roof Top" food court it has amazing view  able to enjoy with many type of food. However this is the most convenient shopping center for all the travelers who are occupied in kandy. Thank you. Namal & Rajanie
This is a really good shopping complex with an awsome food court. It's better than the shopping complexes in Colombo for sure.
Best shopping complex in Sri Lanka yet. Majestic city or liberty plaza aint even close to this standers. It has a Good food court and a kids playing area. And also a roller coaster.

Not much was open as it was a holiday weekend. Did note that just about everything is available here. There's a whole area dedicated to different bank branches and a range of other clothing stores. There's ample parking at an adjacent car park.

Trip with Asiatours with first stop Kandy for 3 days. Touch of old english colony and a lot of cultural impressions. Our driver and guide gave us insight in tea production, woodcarwing an gem mining. Very exciting.

Kcc operates an excellent food court. Everything is organized and clean. The gelato is fantastic. Try out the avocado. The kids play area is probably the best in Sri Lanka. Overall a very well maintained mall.

Visited the Food court recently and the food was flavourful as usual. They have a very wide choice of freshly made Drinks here.The drinks were top quality. We had Mutton Biriyani, Chicken Biriyani, Mutton Curry, Dhall Curry, and Rissoto. All dishes were flavourful and served hot. The colourful freshly made Drinks were a highlight of the visit. We will surely go again. Great value for money. Clean surroundings easy parking.

Kandy City Centre is quite small and worth a visit. Start at the centre at the Queens Hotel, the temple of the Tooth is also worth an hour of your time but no more! We stopped for a coffee at the Empire cafe which was good. The best experience is just walking the streets and trying to avoid the colourful buses. The modern shopping centre is a wast of time you can find these shops anywhere! The lake looks nice but surrounded by traffic so we didn't venture all of the way round.

We are visiting KCC most of the time when we visit kandy. A great place to do some shopping and to have a mouth- watering meal. Food court is clean and you can enjoy a delicious meal while looking at the kandy lake. Few branded products are selling in some shops in the shopping mall. You can buy most of the things you want under one roof. If they could separate some  space for a cinema hall, that would be wonderful.

Modern shopping center in kandy.it was nice and clean 💐place with modern facilitys ..restaurants ☕️,coffee shop,kid play area shopping mall,super market etc... It is a one stop solutions for busy life.

Came to Kandy as it is heavily marketed as a tourist attraction. And although it is rather lovely, very little to do unless you're into the Buddhist attraction and/or tea plantations and botonical gardens. Having done tea plantations in the passed and taken in my fair share of botanical gardens and not really interested in Buddhism, it was all a bit of a shame. Extremely Draconian licensing hours and the restaurants are few and far between. Thank goodness for TripAdvisor for finding those out for us. If coming, I suggest a whistle stop tour... unless you're into things mentioned above.

The Kandy City Centre is a superb shopping mall in the heart of town where you will find pretty well all your needs. There is a huge and very well stocked supermarket with adjacent wine store, two excellent bookstores and numerous clothing, phone, souvenir and technology shops. There are ATMs and toilets (which you have to pay 10 rupees to enter.) The whole place has a clean and modern feel about. it. There are also excellent restaurants within the complex. We set off for shopping and banking in town and could do everything within this Centre.

A food court at top, with an excellent token based system, wide international selection & good service. No alcoholic drinks and limited local dishes. Cheap public carpark adjacent is open all hours. Additional option of a Gelateria opposite.

This was a great find. In the same restaurant, there’s a choice of Indian, Thai, Chinese, Italian, plus plain old fish and chips.  You can choose any starter from any station of the above cuisines and same for main and side dishes.  So you can have a totally unique meal!  Go visit.

A shopping mall/centre is nothing special with a lot of clothes, electronic & food outlets. Compared to some others in Sri Lanka, KCC is actually not that big. However, where it stands above the rest is because of the following. Has ample parking for cheap. Has all except one of the main banks in SL & multiple ATMs to deposit or withdraw cash; with some of the banks even open on weekends including Sundays. Has a post office for letters & deliveries, but also to pay your monthly electricity & water bills. Has 2 of the leading mobile, land line, & internet service providers. Has a supermarket for grocery shopping. Has a food court. Has a kids play area. This is all on top of the multiple clothes, shoes, electronics, jewellery, & souvenir shops, plus cafes & juice bars. The only downside is that you have to pay to use the toilets & the toilets are not as clean as they could be.

Kandy City Centre is a must visit place on a trip to the hill capital. As the name suggests it is located in the centre with ample parking. The shops cater for all needs from clothing to household appliances, banks and a super food court with food stalls catering to international cuisine at very affordable prices. All in all an experience for a day of shopping.

We visited the Kandy city center very late evening when most of the shops and shopping mall were closed. We went straight to the topmost floor which has a great food court having various cuisines. Thai, Italian, Indian, Chinese food served at great prices. Self service and payment is while checking out.

One of the better shopping centres in Kandy.  Good food court with many selections of international food.  Good supermarket to pick up almost anything you’ll need.  Best of all plenty of ATM’s to choose from.

Nice modern mall with a great food court, which had Indian, Chinese, Sri Lankan, Italian and Thai food. The shops were surprisingly good. A couple of sport shops, menswear, womens wear, etc. Money changer on one of the lower floors, and a Mobitel shop where you can get or fill up local simcard for your phone and ipad.

This is a mall with basic amenities, except for the number of banks and ATMs that helps international travelers with FOREX. The ODEL store at Kandy City Center, was rather disappointing as opposed to what I was told.

The directions are explained in the name it self. In the heart of Kandy, kcc gives a nice mall like experience. The shops are alittle pricey. Everything under one roof supermarkets, ATMs a food court and outlet shopping. The food court Has a burger king, gelato places an automated card food court serving  Italian Chinese Thai and Indian food. Although it's not an attraction, if you have a couple hours to kill it's highly recommended. Will go again.

Such fabulous shopping center with a modern high tech food court KCC must visit in Kandy City. Have to give minus10 for the filthy smelly toilets in the ground floor this applies to both gents had to pay Rs10 (small amount) each to walk in to the toilet which is overflowing with water in the men's floor near the urinal covered in urine. When we approached the lady who collected money her reason for the condition was the cleaners has gone for lunch by the look of the conditions in the toilets it seems cleaners been taking a two day lunch brake. We weren't the only one complaining but they kept on issuing tickets for people to go in. We mange to talk to a powers to be a supervisor his poor excuse was that morning new contactors taken over the job and they are not up to standard because lack of training but no apology.
It has a very good food court on roof top! Don't miss the Italian dishes there. I highly recommend the food court!
Really love this place. The food court was superb!. There is a small roller coaster in the building as well.
In the shopping mall of Kandy,modern eatery. Different kitchens offering a choice of dishes. Special dessert counter and a bar (no alcoholic drinks).

I enjoyed my time at the kandy city center since it was really 5to 7 min away from my hotel in which it was far the best place I had lunch it was excellent in taste, money and location . The view up from the restaurant is really pretty and nice you all will enjoy a romantic rain view will having your lunch.

A good combination for a trip especially if raining - a nice selection of shops to browse and at fair prices. The highlight for me was the food I like local spicy food which is almost impossible to find in the hotels and at a fraction of the prices.

This "mall" is in stark contrast to the small shops lining the main streets of Candy.  I would put the quality and shops in this center at a similar level to ones you'd find in Europe or the americas.  Clean, friendly, and a lot of variety.  The basement level had a grocery store, which was quite fun to walk through and get a sense of the types and variety of foods and goods available.  Worth a visit!
The only proper shopping mall I found in whole of Sri Lanka! And it lives up to its name by being at the centre of the city.

World spice (KCC Dining Lost). Oh my God we enjoyed every bite. On our first day in Kandy we came across the food court in city centre. And for 2 days after our lunch and dinner was here. Cleanliness 5 stars Service 5 stars Atmosphere & music 5 stars Value for money .. excellent. So glad we found our way here. We had : - Italian 👌🏼the chef took care of us and added a little extra off the menu .. free of charge. we had a Seafood fettuccine. With extra veg and cheese on top. 5 stars - Thai Tom yum hed (mushroom soup) such a spicy yet soothing soup. 5 stars -Indian 🙌🏼 we had the Mattar paneer (cottage cheese) combo meal with garlic naan. And the Mutton Biriyani we enjoyed every bit. 5 stars

There's a multi cultural food court upstairs with a huge variety on offer. Our driver recommended the biryani & it was absolutely delish! So tasty & excellent value for money. All washed down with an iced tea from the drink vendor. I would definitely go here again! Everything was super spotless & very hygienic looking.
Totally recommend the food court up stairs. The food was delicious, value for money and there was a wide variety of food.

The signage on this place does little to reveal that it is actually a fine shopping mall in Kandy. As are many in Asia, this one has a vertical orientation with several floors of all types of retail shops----upscale and not; with ubiquitous electronics stores there too. The Food Court is quite impressive for a mall, relatively speaking,  with various culinary genres present from Burger King to much finer venues. There is also a roller coaster up top albeit one with a very small footprint. The location is ideal---right in the middle of the city center across the street from the Kandy Lake and Temple of the Sacred Tooth. I liked the architectural design of the building with its blend of a modern glass pyramid and the more traditional Sri Lankan style with tiled roofs. Whether you just want to check out the local mall to distinguish it from others or whether you have that shopping urge, the Kandy City Center is a worthwhile stop.

This must be one of the most updated shopping malls in sri lanka. The level of sophistication found here cannot be matched by any of the shopping malls in colombo. Their dining area caters to fine dining. The choices to choose from are endless. Washrooms were amazingly clean. Loved the hours spent here.

The shopping complex has many branded showrooms and luxury items such as gifts , wrist watches. And the restaurant is bit crowded and a complex ordering process. But the food is pretty good in all 5 restaurants ( Chinese, Indian, Italian, Dessert & Beverages)

Kandy City Center is quite modern and clean for window shopping or to find something of interest. Branded items are not as cheap as back home. There is a grocery shop where one can pick snacks etc at a reasonable price. There is a cafe and a food station court where one can enjoy a variety of choices. The concept is quite interesting where one is given card to enter the food area. One choose whatever to have and it's loaded onto the card which gets paid prior to existing. Friday, Saturday and Sunday they have live entertainment as you dine. It is a nice get away from the hustle & bustles of the streets around.

Super duper place to get away from the rush. All good shops and many banks. It's a full fledge shopping mall with great food Court and a Kiddies play area. Be very careful at this place I lost my camera in few seconds since it's always a busy busy place.

Kandy, Sourrended by Lake, Dalada Maligawa, Peradeniya Park and etc, but there are no any places like KCC to dine and shopping. All food centers in KCC are really good and specially they are making all favorites of food. Also it has lot of shopping centers such as Odel, NoLimit and etc.

excellent place with great shops with great services. you can find banks, book shops, jewellers, tech shops as well as you can go clothing in this shopping mall. there's a new food court name world spice but its too expensive but they serve various of local foods and foods from the other parts of the world.

KCC, small shopping mall in the heart of Kandy is s famous hangout of the young and a popular shopping destination for quality clothing and other items. Clean, good and the best in Kandy and decent in Sri Lankan standard, a foreigner might wonder what this all hype about the place

when you visit Kandy do not forget to visit KCC. This is one of the biggest attraction in the Main City. there are branded shops. Restaurants, toilet facilities,and enough parking facilities., The best place in the town for a comfortable shopping.

Kandy City Center is how I expect a mall to be like. It has a really good variety of shops for clothing, shoes, cosmetics, fashion accessories, electronics, toys, etc. There's an indoor amusement park for children (World Play) on the top floor with lots of entertaining options including an open air mini roller coaster that looks really exciting (unfortunately, we didn't get a chance to try it). There's also an interesting food court offering a variety of cuisines and beverages. We weren't able to check out all areas of the mall but it's definitely well-maintained and has a modern appearance. If you're in Kandy, I highly recommend coming here. It's located in a busy area. Kandy Lake is right outside and there are many shops and restaurants around.

Kandy has very few such places to chill out. Could have been very crowded if not for the day we selected for the visit. Place is well maintained and staff was very prompt and caring. Worth a visit if you are in Kandy

Kandy City Centre (KCC) is located in the heart of the town at No 5, Dalada Veediya near Cargills and Devon Restaurant. The land area it covers is little over one acre. Its front building is old it is but maintained without modernizing as it is involved in the City Kandy Heritage status. The roofs are made in a unique style with high gradient area  in the middle which is the style of it in Kandy athe area since the era of the up country Kingdoms. Photography was not allowed but the Customer Relations Manger Mr Madhawa Jayasinghe and  his assistant Mr. Dharshana Bandara honored my request as the cause is for reviewing. They arrange the Duty OIC to accompany me and I thak him as well. I thank for the kind gesture of the KCC staff. It is a exciting awesome shopping complex which markets not only items/ materials (clothes/shoes/ antiques/ phones/ souvenirs) and services,  but also offers quality, delicious and awesome food of world over plus provide entertainment for kids with a mini Roller Coaster and World Play. As a result children are excited when hearing that they would visit KCC soon.  The people visiting also get fascinating experience with enjoyment and feel happy that they have spent the best time of their life. It is a must visit place for a tourist arriving to Sri Lanka. They generally visit Kandy also, which is considered as the second capital of the country. KCC is clean and bright as the staff does maintenance round the clock. The toilets are clean too and attended to, at all times but have to pay a small sum of Rs 10 meant for the privet organization maintaining it. Staff are helpful and tourists have to inquire from security guards of the location of certain shops as its display not given which is a draw back. The Direct factory Outlet of Melbourne (DFO) displays orientation of each of outlets under different floors. The food Loft is on the top (4th Floor) which was opened in August 2016. It is called as “Dinning Loft”. It has an access road from the vehicle road bordering the lake and to the left of the KCC. Therefore the customers can easily reach the place conveniently. New type of innovation is introduced where an electronic card is given to the customer which is used for ordering food. The payment is made at the departure. The delicious food, sweets, beverages etc from around the world (Italian / Thai / Chinese / Indian) could be consumed in a pleasing surrounding  while enjoying the beauty of the Kandy lake and the mountainous surrounding. The modernized food court gives  a very nice experience for the customers. The variety of food offered is great too. The atmosphere is pleasing.  The food is reasonably priced. Ice-cream parlour provides a range of different tastes of them. KCC Offers good branded goods with choices to select from and the quality of the purchased is genuine. The staff is very friendly and helpful. A playing area and small roller coaster is in operation in the evenings. The fee charge for the roller coaster is on the higher side. I would briefly mention the main  allocations in different levels. They are; Level 1 : Banks , Level 2: Electronic items/ Jewellaery / Tea; Level 3: Fashion clothes, Level 4 :Food Court / World Play , and Level 5: Family Events (Handicrafts / Book Stalls/ Exhibitions) I’m sure you would remember the visit you made to KCC for a long time in your life.
Awesome place with full entertainment for kids and nice dining experience for families. Moreover you can do your shopping too.
Decent shopping complex with restaurants, supermarkets and most of all it is clean. Staff there is really helpful with directions. Really loved the experience. A must visit place in kandy.

We stumbled across this shopping complex which is situated off Dalada Vidya. The complex is clean and bright, has a food court with lots of tables and chairs, restaurant, cinema, supermarket, and a small roller coaster on the roof top! There are name brand shops such as Nike if you are looking for that sort of thing. The toilets are clean (small Rs 10 fee).
As the name suggests the building is built in the middle of the city. This is a place where you can do some decent. Shopping.
World spice centre newly opened at Kandy city centre... Which brings you variety of food from around the world. The quality food and facilities definitely brings you the joy.

We have been to Kandy many a times but this was the first time we visited the KCC. We actually ended up in here accidentally after an evening walk around the Kandy lake. The ambiance in the mall was magnificent and being frank this is a far better mall than what we have at Colombo. It has more international standards as well. It has an in house roller coaster as well. There was an ice cream parlor which I was not mistaken with the name of 'Gelleto' and it was the best ice cream I have tasked from any parlor in the country. Good place to visit especially at night.

Have been looking for a decent restaurant in Kandy and haven't really found anything too impressive so far. By mistake really, we stumbled upon the World Spice Restaurant on the top floor of Kandy City Centre KCC. It's quite a neat concept actually. Upon entering the restaurant you receive an electronic card that you then show when ordering your food and drinks. And when leaving you pay for the whole thing. There's four different cuisines - Indian, Thai, Chinese and Italian as well as sweets and beverages of course. You choose from the menu and then place you order at the respective "restaurant". Nice and simple and no cash needed until you leave (or card). This place opened in August 2016 and I must say it's by far he freshest restaurant (or Dining Loft as they call it) we've come across in Kandy. The ambience isn't the best of course since it's more like a food court but the food is tasty, generous and reasonably priced and the selection is outstanding. Definitely worth a visit!
Best place in Kandy to some shopping and eat. Food court at the top floor has great food. Must try!!!

On the top floor there is a place to dine which allows you to choose a variety of freshly cooked food for a very reasonable price We had Thai and  Italian good the service was amazing along with the chefs who you get to speak with ... There was music in the background and seem to be a hit with the locals
The city centre has everything to offer you. Odel & Aditi are the best stores to shop from at KCC. You get everything under one roof.

When I read that this was the best thing that had happened to Kandy I decided to pay it a visit on my next trip Very disappointing Thus is not a mall It's a maze! Feels constricted and tacky with shiny steel and clutter everywhere There is no feeling of a deep inhalation But a series of tint cutouts, like courtyards looking down to nothing interesting but bald heads and overflowing bosoms. The food court upstairs offers basic "Chinese, Indian, Thai, pastries" all looking woefully sad. So I walk over to the open terrace where the restaurant offers a fairly decent buffet lunch, a good bargain for 595/- rupees. Or so I think. Beware ITS A TRAP they force you to pay for bottled water by telling you they only have tap water. So I ask " you don't offer filtered water?" They say " tap only Saar". Disgusting Pushing and peddling bottled water and fuzzy drinks by not serving plain drinking water is a legal offence Someone should hold them responsible for it and sue them! Not the warmth and hospitality one is used to expect in smiley Sri Lanka. This place tarnished the whole holiday.

They offer a fairly wide variety of food to choose from chinese , indian , italian .There also got a italian pizza stall.coner you can see Gelateria Ice Cream stall Great variety, great taste, good quality

If you are a visitor to kandy or residing in kandy this is a very nice mall to visit where most of the good shops, banks, etc are located. They have recently opened a food court which is very reasonably priced with a children's playing area close by. Without walking the streets this is a convenient spot with a well representation of shops and offices that one needs.

My friends and I were ripped off in Kandy from the so-called gem and jewelry exhibition centers in Kandy where all tour operators take you as part of city center tours. Tour operators and these types of centers for gem stones, batik and silk rip off unaware tourists by charging 300-400% more than the actual price of goods. This is due to the mafia system which exists with the huge commissions imposed by the people involved..... Do your shopping in Colombo. Reputable jewelry shops in Colombo charge usd 3-5 per carat for Amethyst stones as opposed to usd 9-15 per carat charged by the Kandy mafia!! For same quality stones!! BEWARE also spice and herb gardens rip you off in Kandy as well as tea factories where they take you. Be prepared to pay up to 5 times on top of the price!!

Don't miss this place for your meal. Very well exicuted with good foog. We had indian and the juice bar and it was good. The Italian was god too. The snack bar was a bit expensive but overall it was ok.

Recently opened self service collection of Thai, Chinese, Italian and Indian food outlets on Set menus. Separate stalls for beverages and state of the art deserts. Very clean, air conditioned area with large space and panoramic view of the Kandy Lake. Delicious food. Reasonably priced. A plate of fried rice £2.5 and a juice £1.5 in average. Hope this ll help to plan your meal in Kandy.

This is the best place in Kandy do some decent shopping. Air conditioned and decent outlets assure you good quality products. Recently they have add a food court in the roof top and that's the best thing for me in the whole complex. Lot of varieties , clean, excellent environment to dine with your family. I strongly recommend this place .

It's must visit place for FOOD.top floor of this complex restaurant call SPICE WORLD. very good place to eat food.varieties of food.reasonable prices. Clean.quick service.can recommend any one to go there. For shopping it's not the place.i think out side got more choice and reasonable prices.

It's located next to KFC,I couldn't find entrance easily, people on the street didn't guide   me correctly. Shopping mall , Food court and Children's play place is there . Have to get entrance ticket to enter the Kid's play place and have to get separate ticket for each activity/game.
Hugely busy, takes ages to get anywhere due to the constant traffic jams. Perhaps there are nice parts of Kandy but time did not allow us to find them. Just had enough of it and happy to move on.

We decided to go there to have lunch and realised it was the best desicion we made in Kandy. The food court is one of the best in Sri Lanka and fell in love with the overflowing choices we had inside and especially loved the system of billing the food. We decided on indian after taking several rounds and loved the naan as it was freshly made then and there in the mud oven and the tandoori chicken and aloo gobi was delicious! The desserts had a good variety of choices and the beverages to suite anyone! This place was definitely amazing! After you are done with lunch and want to take a joy ride in a small roller coaster, its right outside the food court on the rooftop! Quite a childish escape for an adult too!

Kandy is a frantic, chaotic city. People are friendly and extremely helpful. The food is amazing - all the best food was at local restaurants, cafes and road stalls. We both love curries and when you taste a traditional curry and all the accompanying condiments, prepared by someone who knows how to balance the spice, your journey begins. Every town has a different story, and you need a guide/ driver to help you navigate. Our accommodation was out of the city centre, so we could relax at night out of the amazing chaos, then begin again each morning. Start your day early as the heat builds up. We walked around the botanical gardens during the hottest part of the day but at least there you have plentiful shade from the beautiful old trees. We also visited the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic. Our guide took us to watch the 1000's of pilgrims bring lunch offerings. Be prepared - there are long queues and then a crush to get close to the chamber housing the Tooth Relic, as it is of major significance for Buddhist pilgrims. Being part of it is something you won't experience anywhere else. Only locals can enter the chamber and tourists are very much in the minority. Car parks are huge! Take note of the spot where you park your car! Lesson learnt for us! We were laughing, as our guide was embarrassed at first, but then he laughed with us. I will post 2 pictures that I feel show  some of our experience in Kandy.
I was there with my family it was nice we spend lot of time, food is extraordinary for children they can have there day. This is the best place in Kandy to spend the day

First of all, the location is situated in the heart of Kandy City. Perfect parking solutions and easy accessible roads. Both vehicle and walk in entrances. Variety of shopping malls, food stalls, and service centers are here under one roof. Gaming arcade, mini roller coaster, mini carnival,  mini bowling, mini bumper cars, and so many other gaming and entertaining stuffs are available here. For food lovers there is a Burger King at the roof top, Galleria Ice Cream shop which is exceptionally good taste for your taste buds. And the World Spice Restaurant for all kind of food and beverages with a kitchen staff of more than 200 people. Top rated service through out the shopping mall, from cleanliness to security. Every floor has necessary security to avoid any unnecessary activities around the mall. Washrooms are constantly cleaning and taken care of sanitary items. A must visit place in Kandy. Try some Galleria Ice Cream too... :)

Kandy city is a world Heritage site because it has 125 colonial building with UNESCO symbol. lake middle of the city, sanctuary middle of the city, and heart of the Buddhist temple middle of the city limit...many more..
The city is very moderne and very clean. It has everything you can imagine and 100 times better than colombo, if you want to shop and get around
air conditioned shopping mall with all elegant and exquisite shops, food court with play area on top floor, next to the lake, Tooth Relic Temple and Queens Hotel, modern architecture,

As a busy city that was good for customers. All the thing in one stop stop.bank,supermarket ,food,accessory, cloth,shose etc... That was easy for all of us and thank you very mach for owner.. Place was clean and present muisic...
Wonderful shopping mall in the centre of Kandy. All the famous brands are available and restaurants in top floor.

If you are a busy person who wants to do many things at one place City center helps you a lot . All of the main  Banks , Most kind of Shops , Food Center , Play area , ATM s are in the Kandy City center. It helps me a lot to do banking shopping and Lunch.

Bustling full of life..and traffic as everywhere in Sri Lanka. I wish I had had more time to spend in the city center. We had just enough to look around, buy a few things that are typical, daily objects in Sri Lanka
its a new place in kandy city center. specialy for soping...... if you wand buy a branded some thing try to visite this place. if you want more infomation pls contact us. ( thushaa 0094 77 6043599 )

Kandy City Center Mall located very close to the Temple of tooth relic and the Bogambara lake gives you a better shopping experience when you in Kandy. It is a good place to cool down yourself after a tired walking in the city and the surrounding area. It offers many facilities including shopping, banking and entertainment. If you want branded shopping experience in Kandy, KCC is the place to go. However if more shops are added it will make the KCC the best shopping experience in the Kandy region. Also it cannot be accepted that they charge money when using toilet facilities same as other leading shopping centers in the country. Food court facilities need to be improved too.

I was most fortunate to meet Chirstry the auto driver during our stay at Kandy. He was most helpful in taking us to the tourist sights through out kandy for the entire day at a very reasonable price.  The highlights of my tour was the the visit to the Kadugannawa Tea plantation and photographs with the tea pickers, priceless.  Also I had a Sri lankan  spa as well.  it was all arranged by him and i would recommend him at any time at chrisimmanuel777@gmail.com  very rarely would i recommend someone but his excellent service goes a long way.
Well planned, secured, shopping mall in Sri Lanka. Branded shops available in one roof. worth to visit.
Interesting mall with interesting shops. Additional parking was a plus. Great to just stroll around,
Not much of a shopping Centre. Limited number of shops for such a highly advertised ' City within a City' You will need to pay Rs10 for using toilets too!

If you wanna do a little bit window shopping or to kill a little bit of time in Kandy till things get sorted or till your friends arrive this is the place. Some nice shops to check out and a little food court is there as well.
This is a city like all others very busy with so much traffic and lot of traffic jams, we went just before New Year for the Sri Lankans so they were all out shopping.

This is a mall in the center of Kandy city.You get to see few shops with dresses and a department store in the ground floor.Basically it is worth a walk in a air conditioned space.We didn't buy anything from here as the rates were much high compared to other shops in kandy.
Honestly the prices are a little higher inside the city center. The same shops offer lower prices outside. But the shops are great. A good place to shop and hang out.

Free and clean air conditioned space in the center of Kandy city. Three floors but the basement is all Banks and nothing much for shopping or eating . There is a Burger king Hidden away on the top floor and it is very hot there. Shopping is much more interesting, exciting and charming down the two main shopping streets and the market near the Clock Tower

Kandy is the cultural Center of Sri Lanka therefore expectations are quite high. For me Kandy could not meet expectations as it is very loud & polluted and a big Traffic Chaos. Beside that there are some nice Temples to visit and explore. Especially in the smaller ones staff is very helpfull. For me 1 day in kandy was enough.

Went there while in.town for a wedding they have banks, a post office, all sorts of shops, a super market,food outlets and juice bars.There is also occasionally various entertainment as well.What I loved most was the chocolate shop by CBL

Kandy offers an exciting shopping experience with souvenirs ranging from precious stones and handmade laces to stone and wooden carvings. as i  visit the city in the month of August, i have  got a taste of Kandy Esala Perehera, an annual ritual of the Sacred Tooth Temple. Thus, the  vacation can be an enriching and cultural uplifting one as i choose this sacred and beautiful city.

Its the epicentre of shopping and crowd in Kandy. A good street to do window shopping and stop for a quick bite. It gets very crowded on weekends and evenings helped by the proximity to the Kandy lake where one can witness a good sunset view. Apart from the eateries along the main street there are many by-lanes where relatively cheap options can be found.

We spent three days in Kandy, which was one day too much. The lake which is home to an assortment of birds, monitor lizards, turtles and fast-swimming snakes is well worth a walk around. So is the Buddha temple on the mountain and the Tooth temple beside the lake! Good restaurants can be hard to find on the spur of the moment, do research ahead! Tuk-Tuk drivers and hotels offer trips to elephant orphanages and other things. The elephant visits can be a bit depressing if you are an animal lover. The dance at the cultural centre is.. well, an experience. Don't expect Andrew Lloyd Webber, and go to the bathroom somewhere else first.
We visited Kandy and Colombo and this is the best place we found for shopping. Everything is available under one roof. For shopping I will put this Mall in no.1 and Odel Colombo will be in no.2.

My wife and teenage daughters were delighted, as there were rather many clothing shops, with a good mix of well-known quality brands, and less known local brands. The mall is nice, fascinating to watch the locals shop. I enjoyed my first decent cup of coffee in Sri Lanka, at Burger King on the top floor, where you can sit both in- and outside - while a crazy local dark-skinned long-bearded Santa Claus was dancing Christmas dances to Arabic-Latin disc jockey tunes, together with Mickey Mouse (yes) and a bunch of excited local kids while their parents were watching - one of the more bizarre things I have witnessed in my life.

A so called high end mall but I find the choices very limited in the 4 storey mall. It houses a newly opened Burger King on the 4th floor and a OK supermarket in the basement. The mall has a covered car park and that makes it a convenient location to park and move around Kandy town centre. There is a KFC next to the mall, and a Fashion Bug across the street.

Kandy didnt seem like a hill station at all. Whether was too hot and nothing much to see. Everything in Srilanka has steep entry charges. Much more than i have ever seen in other tourist countries. Kandy is definitely avoidable
This is the best shopping complex in Kandy All the shops and services have Parking also available The prices are high, but the things are good
Kandy city centrel excelent shoping complex in kandy city,Resturant,shop It Amaizing Near to kandy lake

We visited Kandy city centre several times when we were in Kandy. The place is new and have everything we needed. Several banks and Thomas Cook to exchange money apart from shops. There is a burger king on the top floor and it is much better than KFC nearby. Also Roots juice bar in the basement is brilliant. There is a mobitel office to book tickets to travel and movies. The only problem is you need to ask for the place as no sign to show the shopping centre.

Our Tour Guide Lincoln Da Silva was the best to go with. spoke fluent English and his knowledge was second to none. We went on an elephant ride, The elephant orphanage is a must see and Buddhist Temple was phenomenal.
A very interesting place to walk around . We were there on a festival night so the place was so busy. Many grand buildings in the centre, interesting shops and a modern small mall.

In our four days in Kandy, we 'nipped in' to KCC about eight times, if not more. The toilets are pretty good but prepare to pay Rs10 (about 12 cents in my country) for an entry ticket. There's a post office and box on the ground floor and plenty of banks and their associated atms. The ground floor is where you'll find a little supermarket which we used predominantly to top up our water supplies. The little cashew nut vendor outside the supermarket is pretty pricey, I guess...but I just couldn't get enough of the black pepper flavoured ones! The shops aren't anything particularly special but, having said that, between two of us we bought 2 pairs of trousers, 1 pair of shorts, 3 pairs of jandals, a necklace and 2 traditional sarongs. KCC also held a cultural display with dancers, crafts and food at no charge as part of Perahera one afternoon. The burger king upstairs has a curry and rice option and the vegetarian burger is awesome! All in all, KCC is a good place to just get out of the heat and hustle and bustle for a few hours.

A western styled shopping mall albeit basic but modern. There is a supermarket inside which is well stocked with most essentials tourists would need. Plenty of banks and foreign exchange merchants (official). Few retail outlets and a shop which sells goods made for a woman's foundation selling handicrafts and locally produced goods. Good juice bar on ground floor

Kandy City Centre (KCC) is the biggest shopping mall in Kandy with large parking space. Lots of shops covering many areas are available. All in one shopping mall Prices are reasonable. Presence is good. Many banks have their branches at KCC. Only negative point I see here is that there's no proper dinning place here.

We enjoyed our visit here. This place is very smart and well laid out. According to a member of staff we met in one of the shops it's fairly newly built. It has a Baskin and Robins Ice Cream, a supermarket, a Burger King and a few other shops but there are lots of spaces still not used limiting the range of choice in this place but it certainly has potential

The only one shopping complex in Kandy which is connected to a huge car park. Includes shops/services that provides most of the day-to-day needs. KCC has branches of all the major banks, telephone service providers, a supermarket at the ground stair. Also they are open until late (when comparing with other branches). I mostly visit KCC for banking.
A place that looks like a wonderful shopping complex. It's amazing to shopping @ KCC.. All your needs could be accomplished.

Kandy Town has a quaint charm. If one views it aerially, say, from the View Point above the Lake it takes the shape of a rectangle with 3 streets running lengthwise (Brownrigg Street, Castle Street & Trincomalee Street lengthwise, Ward Street and Cross Street forming other 2 shortsides while several other streets all in perfect straight lines crisscrossing this rectangle .Most buildings alongside are ancient dating back to some remnant from the Kandyan kingdom heritage. Within this, is the City Centre on Ward Street. The portal serving as the entrance looks ancient, which, in fact, it is, as it is a pert of the heritage identity, while within it is a modern mall and a shoppers delight with department stores, clothiers, restaurants, supermarkets, banks. It is a fusion of 2 eras !!

I knew I won't have enough time in Colombo and we had some time to kill in kandy after all the attractions closed down around 5-6. City centre's entrance is a little misleading, the architecture of mall inside is also a little confusing. But you have some good stores like Odel, elegant smockers etc inside. Good place to go to.
KCC is connected to the largest car park in South Asia where you can park 700 vehicles. KCC is one of few malls with one stop shop with variety, variance and vanity.

With high expectations of seeing Kandy,got a train from Colombo around 7am,dirty rattling old trains left by the British,the only comfort is bottled water to see you for the journey to Kandy,the toilets are dirty so dont indulge with any food sold by the hawkers on the train that might upset you.Arriving at Kandy before midday,once out in the open from the station,bustling traffic and noise the only tourist on sight were sitting in luxury buses,crossing the roads not for the faint hearted,one could see Government Buildings and many other offices,not all the talk that you are  in little England,that is a myth long disappeared,once noticed that you are a Tourist then many offers come your way, the question is where would you be taken for $100 plus,again much cleaner than the Capital Colombo and places to stay start from British Pounds 30, most of the places did not look that interesting to tempt me to spend the night,my opinion is should you want to stay then two days is  reasonable before you head to Nuwara Eliya,I got late train towards Buddala,I headed towards Eliya to see the water falls and town.

This is the first big shopping mall to come up in kandy. The mall is moderately big with still in the process of growing. New shops are coming in but mostly crowded with clothing shops. Electronic items are very expensive in here, i wouldn't recommend buying it from here. The criticism i have is that they should have a good food court. This is one thing missing. They have a huge car park so parking is no issue. Well a good place to spend a Saturday afternoon if you are feeling like busting a few bucks on shopping!

There may be a few malls around Sri Lanka but The Kandy City Center is the most Exciting malls in the country. If your a lankan you might prefer being in colombo and exploring the malls but this is not like that. Kandy is a City where there's a lot of people walking in and out every minute. This mall has everything except the kitchen sink. This is the most standard mall. This Mall has everything, Electronics, Clothes, Supermarkets, Retail & Wholesale, Banks and Entertainment. Also this Mall is situated right in the middle of Kandy City. People are friendly and helpful. There is a food court which has a variety of food to consume. Toilets and Sanitation are kept up to its standard

Its is better than Colombo, I can't imagine KKC is full of business, every item available at all shops. When you go there you can buy all utensils, communication item, IT, Services, Fashions, foods, fast foods etc. but bit of expensive. I would recommend this for Tourists. There is Small counter for Tourist information Desk. Amazing parking facilities available this place.

Kandy has a nice lake, which takes about an hour to walk around. The best time to do this would be in the evening as the sun sets. The town itself is not particularly charming and apart from the Tooth relic temple, there is not a huge amount to do, but it is a good stop-over point on your way to Nuwara Eilya or Ella.

You can find almost everything in here. Every best brand in every item is available here. Actually you have to spend more to buy something if comparing with other shops outside, but I think that's reasonable when considering about the quality. Be aware about the electric staircases if you are not fond of it. Because I have seen several of them who has fallen while getting into and getting out from it.

Just an FYI, there are a lot of so-called "touts" in this city.  I stopped at a food cart vendor on the street to ask for directions  to the city market.  Immediately a very gentlemanly type came up and said he was going in that direction and did I want to accompany him.  I was a bit hesitant, but he said "no money, it is just down this way, you can follow me".  It seemed safe, broad daylight and crowded streets, so I decided to let him lead me.  He took me to a strip mall type of place, and I told him that this was not it, and he very aggressively told me that YES, this is the city market.  At that point I wasn't sure even though it didn't seem right.  I now realize that he took me to a "market" where he gets a commission off what I bought.  He stayed there with me the whole time, until I finally got rid of him.  Save yourself the aggravation, don't ask directions, get a tuktuk driver and say, Old City Walled Market!
Nice shopping mall located in the heart of beautiful kandy city. Biggest shopping mall in town. Many shops to explore. From souvenirs to high end electronics, everything is there.

if you are crazy for shopping jewels and gems, then you must visit this place, city is silent and calm, with good picturesque location, beautiful fresh breeze, wooden hand work items you can carry for your loved ones. gems are good and price is reasonable as per quality and work.
Was lucky to witness some sort of a festival, with dances on the main street. A lot of eateries in the city centre. Interesting to watch the locals doing their fares

The town of Kandy should be a 'must visit' for anyone going to Sri Lanka. It is the only substantial town outside Colombo that has really good shopping facilities including a new Mall with a variety of clean and interesting stores. Aside from shopping, Kandy is home to many wonderful attractions including the world famous Temple of the Tooth and the beautiful Kandy lake. The climate is good too - obviously it has a rainy season but in hot weather it has a much more acceptable temperature than Colombo. From the town centre one can take a tuk tuk to the lovely Botanical gardens at Peradeniya and nearby temples. There is a vast array of hotels, restaurants and cafes to suit all tastes and budgets. Kandy is a very good base for exploring and for shopping for personal things and souvenirs.

The city centre, the attractions, the lane ways, the people, the lake, the amazing setting in the hills and the walkability make Kandy a great place to visit, a perfect holiday spot. Be brave get the down the laneways and talk the shop keepers, enjoy the colonial vibe. The people love kids, the shopping is great, there a lots of cheap bakeries and juice stalls, the lime juice is fantastic and remember never pay the asking price for anything.

When we arrived in Kandy at the railway station our group was approached by two drivers who drove two Tut Tut's called All Blacks after the NZ Rugby Team. We arranged a price to take us to our hotel and they said they could take us on a city tour the next day to see the highlights. As we only had one full day there we decided to take them up on their offer of a van for 5,000 for the day. We asked if the van was of a good standard and what type? Did it have AC. They told us it was a very good Nissan van and for AC we had to pay 6,000. So we agreed. The next day they arrived in a Nissan van which should of been retired in the 1980's. On arrival at the first attraction it failed to re-start when we were ready to drive to the next attraction. They left us stranded at the Buddha after the owner of the company came in his new Toyota to try and start the old van. To no avail of course. So they could then only offer us the Tut Tut's. Not ideal but we agreed as what else could we do! I requested a price of 4,000 and they agreed. We were then stuck waiting for 45 minutes for the Tut Tut's to arrive. Two of our group wanted to buy certain items but they kept taking us to stores they did not want to visit. The large depressing tourist meccas where busloads are herded in and they get a nice commission. They were all totally unsuitable and a waste of our time. We had already wasted one hour when the old van broke down. By 2 pm we had had enough and asked to go back to our hotel. Then they wanted more money than agreed. One of our group paid them 5,000 just to get them out of our lives! They were to come back at 6 pm but they no showed or may of been late. We did not wait around. If they are at the station when you arrive give them a big miss! We loved Kandy but would hate others to find themselves in the hands of these operators. The All Blacks!

The old town inside the fort is one of the nicest towns we visited in Sri Lanka. Houses, restaurants and for once, quite organised. Several options for dinner and going out and the fort is also an interesting historical place.

The mall is housed in a old Victorian era building built by the British, renovated. You can see some British architecture of that era fused with that of kandiyan. The place is aesthetic pleaser from the outside. In side you would be treated to the beat retail outlet at Sri Lanka plus some banks offering banking services. When I went there there was also an art exhibition on sale. This mall is definitely one of the best in Lanka, even comparing to malls in Colombo. One of the minus point is that there is only one wash room at the whole place plus it's a pay use. With the large crowd that being drawn the place these these facilities are overtaxed and very crowded.

An excellent place for shopping of all kinds. The shopping center consists of few banks and upper floors situated in the center of the city. Easily accessible and a great place for all kinds of shopping

We stayed in Kandy for 5 days, renting an apartment in about 5-10 min drive by tuk-tuk.  The main reason was to visit ancient cities north of Kandy. Turns out that was a wrong decision: the sites are far away and it makes no sense to spend time in long round trips. Frankly, from what we have seen, quality of the sites, costs and associated discomfort do not justify the trips at all. In a case you are adamant about making the trips, rent a place somewhere north of Kandy, closer to the sites. Kandy City by itself is nothing special if you compare it to an average town in Malaysia  and definitely much less interesting or charming than Hanoi or southern India. The last 10 years we have traveled South-East Asia every winter, the area that we like and feel comfortable. From our experience, Kandy is not a place to bother with.

We wanted to do a little shopping to take a break from the historical stuff. We found the city centre mall had some nice shops... reasonable pricing. I bought some cool polo shirts. If you need a break from curry then you can also visit burger king.

A charming city with beautiful hills surrounding it. Must visit the temple complex and botanical gardens. there are wonderful daily cultural dance theaters around the city. The city is also full of excellent hotels and restaurants.

And this is the best way to get around this bustling city, which won't set you back too much either as these guys are everywhere touting for business. Just remember it's very easy to say we'll walk it but, in 45c heat and the same in humidity I don't think so..!   The city of Kandy has much to offer including the much vaunted Temple, lake, shopping centre, markets, military cemeteries, restaurants, museums, as well as the surrounding hills complete with panoramic views.  The Mall as expected is full of the usual high end shops which one avoids on holiday unless your absolutely bored rigid  and feeling homesick of course. The main attractions though, do speak for themselves like the Temple, lake etc. And are well worth the stay here alone, as for the restaurants well, let's just say it's a curry lovers paradise and there are many other eateries on hand to suit everyone including the sad ones who can't see past Burger King on holiday...! We did walk and Tuk Tuked around here over 4 days, criss crossing this busy city and never had any bother at all however, one night outside the Temple we were approached by a seedy looking character who asked us if we wanted something "Special" ?  Catching on right away I chased him with a few choice words in his ears, as getting caught with dodgy substances could easily result in spending the rest of your holiday in a tiny Sri Lankan cell with 30 other guys who want to be your "Friend" and isn't the best way of seeing a prison attraction in Kandy especially the showers...So be warned..! As for the shopping I would suggest going to the main market for any trinkets, and don't forget to haggle for everything, the only down side to visiting this Temple is the high price they also charge for us "Foreigners" to enter which should be free in my opinion. But, this is Sri Lanka and the Govt, run attractions see us as cash cows which is a great shame here and spoils the moment. Just keep an open mind and you'll enjoy this unique relatively friendly city and sadly, as is the way of the World these days, I would advise any lone females to be on the side of caution and keep their wits about them especially at night as it doesn't take much to be complacent in a strange city ...Stay safe and Enjoy..!
A beautiful city with many attractions and full of vibrancy. Visit the Tooth Relic Temple complex and the Botanical Gardens are a must.
Good place to shop as some shops sell almost as low as market rates.. Only one eatery on top, the burger king. But the mall is surrounded by restaurants.. They've got an Odel store too.
